result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine M Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] cases #14CF428, #14CM416, #15CF50 called at 2:08pm. 
Defendant Antoine M Brown in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Mr. Brown makes a statement. 

In Case #14CF428 on Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Brown to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  6 months.  This sentence is consecutive to any previously imposed sentence. 
In Case #14CF428 on Count #4, the Court sentences Mr. Brown to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months.  This sentence is concurrent with Count #2
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 121 days credit for time already served.
The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo a Certified Batterers Intervention Program
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs 
--no contact with Melissa Schultz
--to pay any outstanding amount due for court fees, costs, assessments, and surcharges
--not to commit any acts of violence or make any threats to any person

-----------------------------------------------------------------
In Case #14CM416, the Court sentences Mr. Brown to:
--serve 9 months Jail, to be served in WSPS; concurrent with the sentences in case #14CF428
--any outstanding costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges amount is to be entered as a civil judgment
Days credit for time already served:  121  days
------------------------------------------------------------------
In Case #15CF50 on Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Brown to:
--serve  9 months Jail, to be serve in the WSPS; concurrent to the sentences in case #14CF428
--any outstanding costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges amount is to be entered as a civil judgment
Days credit for time already served:  209  days

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 2:54pm
Clerk's response to defendant's request for copies
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Clerk's response to defendant's request for copies
Letter from the defendant re sentence credit

Cases 14CF428, 14CM264, 14CM416 & 15CF50 called together at 11:06 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Antoine M Brown in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall informs the Court that the State will not be requesting bond forfeiture, with the entry of pleas

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Cts#2 & #4-14CF428, Ct#1-14CM416 & Ct#2-15CF50; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 14CM264 and all remaining counts in 14CF428, 14CM416 & 15CF50
Court finds that the Defendant has been properly charged as and convicted as a repeater

On Cts#2 & #4-14CF428, Ct#1-14CM416 & Ct#2-15CF50, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 3 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for employment, counseling, treatment, therapy & child care (15CF50); to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--Certified batterers intervention counseling
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence
--To pay costs of $972 ($243 each count)
--To pay $800 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (Ct#2-14CF428)
--No contact with Melissa Schultz (dob: 7/29/88) unless both she and agent agree and after the Defendant completes certified batterers intervention counseling
--No contact with Melissa Schulz (7/28/81)
--To pay $99 subpoena fees (14CF428-Ct#2)

Days credit for time already served: 21 days-14CF428
Days credit for time already served: 21 days-14CM416
Days credit for time already served: 18 days-15CF50
State withdraws bond forfeiture motions; Court orders bonds to be applied to costs
Recess: 11:48 am Reconvene: 11:48 am 
ADA Hall requests the Court provide Mr. Brown with No Contact Warnings
Court advises Mr. Brown of No contact violations and penalties
Recess: 11:49 am
Final status/scheduling conference on March 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.
with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CF428, 14CM264, 14CM416 & 15CF50 called together at 10:35 am [Clerk SH] 
[Reserve Judge Donald Hassin presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Antoine M Brown in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa submits plea paperwork & informs the Court that all matters will be resolved today
Court reviews plea questionnaire with Mr. Brown; ADA Beck recites plea agreement for the Court; Mr. Brown confirms this is his understanding of the offer of the State

Constitutional rights given; Victim Rights compliance verified; During plea colloquy Mr. Brown indicates that he does not remember the indicident and does not believe he committed actions alleged in the criminal complaint in case 14CF428.
Court informs parties that It can not accept plea as Mr. Brown is indicating he does not believe he committed alleged offense. Court informs parties that It will set all matters over in front of Judge Koschnick on 3/19/15 so Mr. Brown may have more time with Counsel and that the trial dates will remain on the calendar. 
Recess: 10:58 am

COVERING CASES 14CF428, 14CM416 & 14CM264; Original bond document received from JESO on 1/12/15

Defendant Antoine M Brown in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ALL CASES: On Motion to Modify Bond

Cases 14CF428, 14CM264 & 14CM416 called at 1:34 pm
Defendant Antoine M Brown in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court review procedural posture of the cases.
Court finds that all 3 warrants have been satisfied by the defendant's appearance and should be removed from any database they had been entered into.
Attorney Zarwell advises that the defendant has been working long hours and inadvertatly missed the court date.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $750.00 CASH bond to cover all 3 files, with previous non-monetary conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Melissa Schulz  
-Booking at JCSD 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No presence at 309 W. Rockwell Ave in Fort Atkinson

On 14CF428:
Service of Complaint admitted; felony charge (Count #1) and maximum penalties recited; reading of misdemeanor charges (Count #2- #9) and maximum penalties waived; reading waived
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Attorney Zarwell waives Preliminary time limits so Attorney De La Rosa can be at the hearing, requests a prelim. date on or after 1/5/15.
Court orders a preliminary hearinf date to be set on 1/6/15 or after.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:53 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 1/6/15 at 8:30 am (14CF428)  
Status: 1/6/15 at 8:30 am (14CM264 & 14CM416)

Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: No explanation can tender to court for non-appearance
